column1: What suggestions do you have on the platform improvement for supporting social learning in GitHub？

column3: It have to make bbs that like a reddit.
Better integration with free services such as gitter and friends
Overview site for learning materials on github
Maybe to help non-programmers to participate more often in this platform
Have a way to learn from best developers and project contributors for better contribution on that project and using the project.
You are doing a good work.
Maybe add a Q&A chat feature.
Find a way to game the process (badges like Stack Overflow ?) Find a way to mesure achievements and show them on profile.

Special category/section for these types of projects like: learning.github.com

Make it a separate area that can be search without being polluted from other Github results.

Allow for a rating system (this would be hard).
I dont have any right now
Better support for documents ingesting, sometimes people wanna import word or ppt...
A way to learn an open source codebase faster
Improving the option to view code

I cannot say because I have not explored everythi
ng yet.
Better filtering and curation of projects
now i don't have any suggestions to support you but i will tell you as soon as i get one

Work with Microsoft to get solutions to issues like this http://tinyurl.com/y98qaz2m and other Git functionality that is commonly used.  Also, I have moved everything to BitBucket because I can have free private repos, you charge for that.  Although I agree that sharing knowledge is great, there are times that I would prefer to keep something private.  As a family man I do not have any spare $$ so I searched out an alternative.  P.S.  TFSOnline also allows private repos and has the option of git style or tfs style.
Just to make things a little bit explicit
Finding ways to motivate companies that are averse to contributing to open source.
bot that can suggest issues, pull requests, code related to  a subject
Make a real tutorial project for people to learn github
Collections of the materials by target platform or programming approach would be nice. It's not really easy to find the learning material for the track you are interested in.
some sort of "promotion" letting users know this feature exists

Maybe a completely separate platform that is focus on social learning. Again, there is nothing GitHub centric about version control or project issue tracking that significantly impacts learning different from other methods.
Perhaps some tying in with other online learning sources like Khan Academy, to get more exposure
Stackoverflow is my favorite social learning platform, so maybe Github can be more like "Stakcoverflow" would be great
Can't think of any suggestions mostly because I'm satisfied by the features that Github currently provides. Good job! Keep going.

Make the UI easier to use, for example i can pin some repositories that  I would visit everyday and do learning there. Alsp support repos with learning materials, for example if they tag there repo as a learning resource , treat them with a different UI
I think as of now github is on a level where 99% of growth will depend on its users and their content. As for github, you guys have to come up with good ways to help people do that.
Offering microclasses, the next step is certs
teach students how to use and get benefit out from Github through a video.
Better explanation of the code. Maybe create a big file for each repo called "TUTORIAL.md" that introduces us to how the code was built globally.
As of now I haven't thought about that
a discourse / gitter like chat window as an optional sidebar
I don't have any suggestions right now

github helping developers or students who learn here ,in improving their skills .
no suggestion .
Github doing a great job 
thanks for it :)
It would be great if Github will start conducting HACKATHONS in Github Platform itself.
None (I use git via FreeCodeCamp, so their tutorials are lesson based)

Would love to see some sort of merit points for people who are polite when handling issues. Some programmers tend to answer questions as though there is a stick up their asses and this tends to scare the beginners away.
Suggestions to people to follow would be great
I wouldn't want GitHub to do more than it is designed to do.
provide a platform more focused on learning
or projects are a good start, but we need more cross repo tools.
i do not participate in learning projects
maybe a way to flag a repository as a "learning project repository"
Encourage devs to be beginner friendly
Be able to subscribe for changes in one file (that will be useful for learning repos and regular repos)
A real time chat room will be helpful
That this question not be required lol
Issues could be more adjusted for discussions instead of being bug-centered.
Increase Githubs social aspects which arleady are great but could be more.
Now the platform is very good
At the moment, no improvement is needed.
If there is something new I will love to use it

Guidelines for people that want to create learning materials would empower more people to share what they've learned and want to share.

I imagine something similar to PR message templates but for repos that are meant for teaching materials.
Maybe it's good if Github supports online code playing with user uploaded boxed environment such as docker?
Github needs to be more social or more learning based. It's really lacking which is why I suspect this survey is being released
Add support for tests and grads

Add some interface to assemble github repo into a course. I know it sounds lame, but i'd really appreciate some coursera-esque (or udacity or edx) interface. Maybe some github-based service like travis/binder/rtfd that takes a repo and some formatting and converts it into a course page or something. This kind of something: http://cornercode.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/edx-1-large.jpg .

For  a dream example, this - https://github.com/yandexdataschool/Practical_RL/tree/master/week4 - into a unit with reading/video sections and 3 small coding assignments.

Not only this would make it easier for learners to participate, it would also make it simple to detect & fix points where learners struggle.

p.s. and yeah, i know, developing such a service would be a whole lot of work for only a small section of github community. Just dreamin'
Need a real time chat for github repo
More interactive modules since the modules from the official website is really really hard to learn.
I'm new to all this so I don't have any suggestions for improvement
chat & support for multimedia calls via webRTC on the browser.
more detailed guidance for developers so that they can help
Maybe one chat, in order to get answers quickly when you get stuck.
Suggestion system based on what people search, such as sending emails of "You might be interested in there game programming projects" cause I've been searching for it the most...
Merge request icon with count on issues to identify what issues are not being working in progress.
I can't remember it was a very long time ago

- Promote Pull Request checks which verify correctness of proposed solution
- Specifically encourage creation incomplete application for learning purpose. Student should be able to have some moderate pain studying
- Have individual checklists for students, maybe related to milestones.
I think it is already cooool.
Make student pack for self learners
I have suggestion that there should private repo quota for free users.
Social sharing, gamyfication an achievement system perhaps
Develop some sort of testing or quiz platform.
Bug fixing guide for beginners and contributions guide.
Live chatting to answer the student's questions.
Make more options and easier options for beginners to participate in open source. Clearly define beginner issues with labels/tags and clearly explain the issue for beginners.
Ability to rename non textual files
Make it available to every user without any difficulty. Make it user friendly.
Sometimes it would be cool if I could message the creator and have them to do a breakdown of their code and why they did what they did.
some real time chat integrated would be nice. the code review sucks big time too, i'd love something like gerrit instead of github's ui
GitHub doesn't make much sense as a learning platform.
I think things are fine for now
Perhaps streamlined educational for newbies...but then again that is a problem in itself...
Relevance with given version. Don't let content at any location go stale.
Provide advanced materials for people who wants to dive deeper into the topic.
moore spanish or latin people for making a great job's and be a good devops
Github should improve the statistics of the programming language used by each repository, often confused with assets or vendor folder
I would like to send private messages to other user sometimes, and I can`t find this functionality.
An easier way to gather people in small groups, as opposed to institutions.
Provide separate​ section for study materials
